you could wipe out the rules you added.
How can I tell which firewall is underneath?
llutz I can handle commandline and such quite well, but when it comes to configuration of my machine I am afraid to mess things up. ^^
run:  sudo iptables -L      does it output: http://paste.ubuntu.com/916319/
The printed list is much longer... But the entrys you pasted are among them.
llutz My problem is solved. :-) thank you guys! I'll definitely have a look into iptables.
you can cron as user too, if what you want to schedule needs root access you will need to run:  sudo crontab -e
otherwise: crontab -e   will cron as the user
if you have a desktopUI you can use gnome-schedule as a GUI. Run with gksudo to use it as root
